summary:
Brief Biography - Robert A. Ancker, MD

Born and raised in Louisiana near New Orleans. 
Married with three college age children.
Interests in winter sports, road & mountain biking, hiking, good food, arts, culture, professional sports, travel & coffee!

Practicing Hospice & Palliative Medicine for 25 years.

Experience summary:
•	Completed medical school, residency and 1-year Rural Family Medicine fellowship at Louisiana State University Medical Center (now LSUHSC) in Shreveport, LA. 
•	Board Certified in both Family Medicine and Hospice & Palliative Medicine CAQ with current recertifications.  
•	Full spectrum Family Medicine practices
o	South Lake Tahoe, CA and Minden, NV (1994)
o	Winchester, VA (1999)
•	Began career in hospice as the first medical director of hospice at Barton Memorial Hospital in South Lake Tahoe, CA (1996)
•	Subsequent move to Winchester, VA and continued medical directorship at Blue Ridge Hospice (1999)
•	Subsequent move to Coeur d’alene, ID to become the first full-time medical director of Hospice of North Idaho and established the Inpatient Palliative Care program at Kootenai Health (2005)
•	Provided inpatient palliative care consultations at Kootenai Health as well as Northern Idaho Advanced Care Hospital (LTAC) from 2005 to 2011 and again 2016 to 2018. 
•	Ongoing service on the Kootenai Health ethics committee. 
•	Currently the only physician provider, with Nurse Practitioner support, for Hospice of North Idaho with ADC 145 including a 21 bed Hospice House inpatient unit (since 2011) as well as oversight of the Community Palliative Care program. 

Other Accomplishments:
•	HCR40/POST Task Force in 2006/2007: updated Idaho’s DNR statutes to include the creation of the Idaho POST (POLST) DNR form in 2007
•	Featured presenter on the Idaho Quality of Life Coalition’s DVD: A Clinician’s Guide to Starting Conversations about End of Life/POST Consult. 
•	Frequent lecturer on hospice, palliative care, pain management, and end of life issues locally and statewide for a variety of state organization annual meetings, healthcare providers and facilities, and hospital and hospice staff education.
•	Kootenai-Benewah Medical Society: Past President
•	Idaho Medical Association: Current member Board of Trustees, Trustee District One
